9c331cb2-e261-4bdf-af49-fe53141ed6b4.text: (a)  The statement of net income and gains and losses recognized directly in equity is presented on page 198.

7578e9a3-f9d8-4e15-894f-7753b8f7472f.text: (b)  Share capital as of December 31, 2014 was made up of 344,872,883 shares at a par value of 5.50 euros. During the fiscal year, movements affecting share capital were as follows:

fa0e346a-186e-41d0-be54-c268ce5e351c.text: on June 2, 2014, share capital increase by capitalizing share premiums and retained earnings, and attribution of 32,095,812 free shares at an exchange rate of one new share for

3e498cea-6794-4edb-af4f-f68cdd27bd2a.text: 10 existing shares and one new share for 100 existing registered shares held continuously from December 31, 2011 to June 1, 2014 inclusive. This share capital increase was realized

acec94e0-a056-4560-8cd2-e249eb8ae95f.text: via deductions from “Additional paid-in capital” for -24.7 million euros and “Reserves” for -151.8 million euros;

7212809b-fb78-4f82-83ce-60ee3f6ef8a4.text: creation of 511,594 shares in cash with a par value of 5.50 euros resulting from the exercise of options before the attribution of free shares;

f29e2eb9-45c6-4eb3-a2f3-d36f39a424e1.text: creation of 433,801 shares in cash with a par value of 5.50 euros resulting from the exercise of options after the attribution of free shares;

e0569f78-8c4c-4017-b809-1e0841eb640d.text: share capital decrease resulting from the cancelation of 1,000,000 treasury shares before the attribution of free shares.

db9ff4b8-278a-47da-944f-4b8a5ab77369.text: (c)  “Additional paid-in capital” was increased by the amount of share premiums related to capital increases for 53.5 million euros and reduced by the amount of share premiums related to the

54ab189c-2950-4078-a9c1-1d6a1c1a6d69.text: cancelation of treasury shares for -84.3 million euros.

65a7ed14-a026-4051-b9de-38804264dd59.text: (d)  The number of treasury shares as of December 31, 2014 amounts to 1,293,164 (including 1,192,033 held by L’Air Liquide S.A.). During the fiscal year, movements affecting treasury

462af18e-3465-4519-a27f-b2aecfd32665.text: acquisitions net of disposals of 1,193,000 shares at an average price of 97.44 euros, of which 1,199,000 shares before the attribution of free shares;

35bbc22b-cb4f-4109-98e2-c875db616dc3.text: cancelation of 1,000,000 shares before the attribution of free shares;

d5e52bf0-bdf9-46bc-b670-285e8c3fe34a.text: creation of 132,462 shares as part of the attribution of free shares;

51b8a61d-119e-49c0-8374-8c52db1bb30a.text: allocation of 125,665 shares as part of conditional grants of shares.

c735abcc-ab2e-42b7-a0a9-3a8ace266d18.text: (e)  Changes in “Retained earnings” primarily result from the cancelation of gains and losses arising from disposals of treasury shares and from the tax impacts related to items recognized

867e507c-de65-48aa-99cc-3db08c9a77d5.text: (f)  Transactions with minority shareholders recognized directly in equity include the effects related to the revaluation of put options granted to minority shareholders.

518fc8f8-d9e7-447f-adcd-28f00784c16e.text: subsidiary Management to make estimates and use certain

ddaa259c-039b-4bb4-b888-82d81af65035.text: assumptions which have a signiﬁcant impact on the carrying

5e875329-9f0e-45ad-81e7-4b2591f1c521.text: amounts of assets and liabilities recorded in the consolidated

22bf516a-fdf7-4bf4-a84c-e3d40622826f.text: balance sheet, the notes related to these assets and liabilities,

dce88f05-4d71-4e4b-b0ec-bab42666ed8e.text: the proﬁt and expense items in the income statement and the

9436c249-f121-4854-a641-3f20bb8e0684.text: commitments relating to the period-end. Balance sheet, income

9ad4f687-c653-435d-8b68-ba4ddd120947.text: statement and cash ﬂow statement line items could differ should

22af8e9c-22d1-466c-bc09-bdb4457e078a.text: the subsequent actual results differ from the estimates. The most

aeb2537b-ac49-4fee-931f-b2b349fc769e.text: signiﬁcant estimates and assumptions concern the following:

7f29b2b6-b3b3-46db-948c-ce94322cf723.text: the estimated useful life of property, plant and equipment used

0a376381-0f33-4138-9717-1de0ac33b803.text: for calculation of depreciation and amortization: these estimates

0a25f9d4-1c00-43a6-9175-2fb8a9ccb357.text: are described in section 5.e of the Accounting policies;

f28fee3b-4e3a-437a-865b-f0f312651004.text: the assumptions used to determine provisions for employee

3520ae64-7e5e-4214-a0c4-4f88f4a1586c.text: retirement beneﬁt obligations: the actuarial assumptions used

bd1f19db-4e5a-4583-b1f2-6d84ab560232.text: (employee turnover, mortality, retirement age, salary increase,

652dfb2f-bd6a-4c36-9ed6-163c0787d69b.text: etc.), and the discount rates used to determine the present

1ef65662-be01-4e6f-813c-6694c192bf26.text: value of obligations, as described in notes 24.2 and 24.4;

c3f8ac64-05ef-4d30-9d1c-039d22573125.text: the estimates and assumptions concerning asset impairment

160f8d65-7195-4174-a697-7b6436574196.text: tests, as described in section 5.f and in note 11.2;

260f5985-2a40-4a99-a56c-2c836e826daa.text: the methods used to recover deferred tax assets on the

a5f1cf65-525b-45c3-b1c0-6da66925406c.text: the risk assessment to determine the amount of provisions for

33c709cd-3137-46e0-aa06-fdce84143422.text: The consolidated ﬁnancial statements were prepared under the

f56751ce-e895-40c0-8c81-47eadbbc69cc.text: historical cost convention, except for available-for-sale ﬁnancial

0430fb17-a49c-4b21-9fc0-5e563971236d.text: assets and ﬁnancial assets and liabilities measured at fair value

1fe23008-c25c-43c0-a9df-29054a61489a.text: through proﬁt or loss in accordance with IAS32/39. The carrying

90c1d850-bdca-47f6-8077-a9bcb4f1e1df.text: amount of other assets and liabilities hedged against fair value

b21a928d-26fa-4acf-8e83-b49441807534.text: risk is adjusted to take into account the changes in fair value

1ca83bac-26df-4bdf-ab61-a1f808476720.text: attributable to the hedged risks. In addition, the principles of

7224beb8-fe5f-425c-bb52-e5248d3c9956.text: fairness, going concern, and consistency were applied.

bd1d6694-9da3-454a-aa8d-46ed87d4e75d.text: equity method for joint ventures and associates;

0d7f9de7-9f87-48b9-9b34-51bef9a34ce5.text: assets, liabilities, expenses and revenue of joint operations are

9505b08e-b6ff-4210-90c8-fedc9cfd0692.text: recognized in relation to the Group’s interest in these entities.

c1b7a499-edcd-4029-a496-0c70bf8f6dd4.text: All the subsidiaries or companies in which the Air Liquide Group

5a3b51c8-8082-4241-9c82-e4c5b184e84c.text: exercises control are fully consolidated. Control exists when all the

ed532fc5-20bd-42a9-84b2-4a248632eb87.text: the Group has existing rights that give it the current ability to

56c6d137-1039-4712-89b1-57741f46eb0f.text: the Group is exposed, or has rights, to variable returns from its

eb465ae0-a9f5-47d9-9026-f717ef37fcb0.text: the Group has the ability to use its power over the entity so that

eea114ce-4c18-4252-906c-0d33e6b5b529.text: it affects the amount of the returns.

3cfd2d44-7608-4f5f-aee2-323428c40254.text: Companies are fully consolidated from the date the Group obtains

b126da74-4d60-45a7-a17d-8c5ff7cc80ec.text: control and until the date on which control is transferred outside

2f40c85f-711a-440d-bd67-e9971034a383.text: Joint operations are joint arrangements whereby the Air  Liquide

f60bb286-956b-496c-a38d-1958a5da1306.text: Group has joint control with one or several parties through

aeb28d20-c0bd-45d6-91bf-507f3dc1f770.text: a contractual agreement, which gives it rights to the assets and

b201a8ac-cf21-4981-b2ea-165aaf9f2b63.text: obligations for the liabilities of the entity.

5200b598-aaf7-410f-8367-9a45fc39637b.text: Assets, liabilities, expenses and revenue of joint operations are

90d33648-6404-4816-a0b9-28ea84b7b51b.text: recognized in relation to the Group’s interest in these entities.

5e45b1c0-a5c9-4a92-ae4d-cf3f88be1518.text: These amounts are recorded on each line of the ﬁnancial

3ce0be20-73c1-4e04-a1a6-7fd5d474e0d2.text: statements as for the consolidated entities.

80c1ad09-0c76-4394-b1f7-fd6e5e5a4d4a.text: Joint ventures are joint arrangements whereby the Air  Liquide

9892e821-6600-4a1f-8a1b-3a6ff61102c1.text: Group has joint control with one or several parties through

efb8fac0-75ed-47a3-87ca-750f9b4e199a.text: a contractual agreement, which gives it rights to the net assets

b74bd0ef-0f52-4fb9-ba7f-f6888063dd7b.text: Joint ventures are consolidated using the equity method. Under

44399f36-249e-416c-90d3-979898ff62a8.text: this one, the net assets and net proﬁt of a company are recognized

242d0f9d-85cf-4bd2-91f1-cf5a23e5f952.text: prorata to the interest held by the parent in the share capital.

45bcca7f-6f39-4e20-9869-a7bddf58fb00.text: On acquisition of an investment in a joint venture, the goodwill

835e83ed-b221-48a7-8e35-b861a90630cc.text: relating to the joint venture is included in the carrying amount

0e8c94b0-4e1f-4557-8c3d-d11936148706.text: Associates are investments over which the Air Liquide Group has

d77f03ec-d7a4-42cb-ab87-0c7e1fea1e65.text: signiﬁcant inﬂuence (generally when the Group has more than a

413104cf-80c0-4588-a686-e3efb4c38b95.text: Associates are consolidated using the equity method. Under this

a3fa2b4d-5c29-4e53-8e19-05e4c0a10cd7.text: one, the net assets and net proﬁt of a company are recognized

b617d2ce-45d3-4021-b6f7-08f8e45626dd.text: prorata to the interest held by the parent in the share capital.

6aa13854-a9f0-4079-96b3-031a60444a21.text: On acquisition of an investment in an associate, the goodwill relating

6f8175db-e8d3-4911-8e05-d8147dac6cea.text: to the associate is included in the carrying amount of the investment.

aa225810-b82b-4e00-95f1-362d03bcb424.text: The ﬁnancial statements of subsidiaries, joint arrangements and

7aa2bcce-fb9f-4a2f-86c0-3a982c762ce7.text: associates are prepared as of December 31.

2a8435cf-680f-408b-bf1d-9e45be94e573.text: All inter-company receivables and payables, income and expenses

0fa2535c-9d94-44ca-b64d-3959e2757771.text: and proﬁts or losses are eliminated.

63d1199f-05d0-43dc-a9db-bc636b200698.text: Movements in the provisions, which have been established in

8c6b0c07-d781-4420-b6a0-3a7df73e1363.text: compliance with tax regulations or which are similar to reserves,

b981afcb-ccda-48fb-8166-8d37ad8fdfb8.text: are eliminated in the determination of consolidated net proﬁt.

5de560a9-bf9a-400a-aedb-d59efc63b5ac.text: Deferred taxes are recognized for all temporary differences

ff50a0ec-9b78-48c8-a263-f57b2ddf8094.text: between the carrying amount of assets and liabilities and their

9fc9f0f3-f814-4cec-8166-caa771b3f948.text: tax base, excluding non-deductible goodwill and the other

e877dd86-c1a8-4dbd-930a-152f4ec019bc.text: exceptions provided in IAS12. Deferred tax assets are recognized

f333e4a6-b6a6-4cf5-8273-51cb68b47e36.text: on all deductible temporary differences provided that it is highly

be5e57e1-572c-48c7-bf8c-29aa7f2867e7.text: probable that the tax beneﬁts will be realized in future years.

6334503f-112a-4e7e-a04b-a484cdd0e36c.text: Deferred taxes are calculated at the tax rate applicable when the

6c9e509b-f034-422a-ba9c-361bdc229413.text: temporary difference is reversed and allowed under local regulations

7c6e9101-8f8e-4281-8f05-0f9596627792.text: at the period-end date. The liability method is applied and any

ae9e49d0-605d-442c-92c6-bb8a4bc47f9c.text: changes to the tax rates are recognized in the income statement,

851ebecf-d174-4fe0-a7e6-15907189d623.text: except those related to items directly recognized in equity.

c19c7601-30f8-46d1-a001-6c911bc72a88.text: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are offset if the entities have a legally

c2680a58-dfef-4343-8fe3-d22d2ee738b5.text: enforceable right to offset and if they relate to income tax levied by

a02b09a7-8241-4593-9aa9-de2dc8677f49.text: the same taxation authority. Deferred taxes are not discounted.

bbc09488-0a43-44ed-bfe9-cc3959780c68.text: At the balance sheet date, the ﬁnancial statements of foreign

d399c3f0-d826-488e-9920-632b2ac3f121.text: subsidiaries are translated into euros as follows:

e27b7e10-f9c5-499c-bf45-76568ba90e7e.text: balance sheet items, at the ofﬁcial year-end exchange rates;

b021ec67-a9eb-4e7e-b0fe-48d25ea18a30.text: income statement and cash ﬂow statement items, using the

3f0178cd-927a-4d16-9417-34a3db525043.text: average exchange rate over the period for each currency.

f56bb31c-bf4a-43fb-9ea3-7a308ce75e6a.text: Exchange differences are recognized under a separate item

97b1f491-dc7d-4fdc-95a9-ee14f9176263.text: “translation reserves” in gains and losses recognized directly in equity.

635b4ffe-0310-4255-b6a0-00bbeab0552c.text: Cumulative foreign exchange gains and losses as of January  1,

3bad5225-8913-4d5b-8e2c-211e242f3f81.text: 2004 arising from the translation into euros of the ﬁnancial

ef98a14b-a786-4062-ae14-68d887646585.text: statements of foreign subsidiaries located outside the Euro zone

54145312-1b19-4e37-b0d5-35b26ce910ed.text: have been maintained as a separate component of equity.

6a81441f-66d0-468b-ba3b-524327826b44.text: On removal from the scope of consolidation, the cumulative

46964e93-8172-43bb-a7a0-ca9491fd8080.text: exchange differences of a company whose functional currency is

be1b4c4a-3661-43f5-ace7-4dc0c122dbc0.text: not the euro are recognized in the income statement.

18065fcb-54c9-436c-808f-0c326025b152.text: a.  Revenue from the sales of goods and services

02c66273-6310-415e-9448-5923ff128f63.text: Revenue from the sale of goods is recognized when the

9c12a8c0-3897-4819-aeb8-d6395306fb4f.text: signiﬁcant risks and rewards of ownership have been transferred

acb51bc7-a7df-4d4e-a14a-406319d286b4.text: to the buyer, net of sales taxes, rebates and discounts and after

d4c7a634-7ad5-44c8-ae13-c9d9e889aec6.text: Revenue associated with service delivery is recognized in

f1ef7f92-7e9d-40e8-b9b3-739f71ca8886.text: reference to the stage of completion of the transaction when it

7d97e4e5-fdaf-43ad-8b6f-2c441423c4e6.text: Contract revenue and costs associated with construction contracts

dda4874b-ae31-47ea-b403-fe90c65af13a.text: are recognized as revenue and expenses respectively, based on

a86da917-6d76-437f-9c37-4a06dbf2e5d9.text: the stage of completion of the contracts at the balance sheet date.

dab005e5-989f-4536-be8e-84bab071931c.text: The margin realized at the stage of completion is recognized only

e713fdb9-348b-410f-bde7-f48670031d7a.text: when it can be reliably measured. When it is probable that total

6888b4a8-df8d-4b0c-b1ee-671c51e425ac.text: contract costs will exceed total contract revenue, the expected

7d1f386f-6f72-4af8-8baf-b29a1ce7049b.text: loss is immediately recognized as an expense.

183d3fce-540c-4a5e-a151-bfe5e472bcad.text: The stage of completion is assessed by using the ratio of contract

642ab6e9-9900-41ac-acc5-7a62ba4bcf67.text: costs incurred at the balance sheet date versus total estimated

70a30274-6bc6-4390-b8c1-943c618e56eb.text: The Group has prospectively applied IFRS3 revised and IAS27

617c6aa0-ae16-4c5a-be7b-fc06c2800dba.text: When the Group obtains control of an acquiree, the business

39fcd3cd-26c3-4d48-af5b-d8d241db25af.text: combination is accounted for by applying the acquisition method

3a091303-b821-4206-a295-0d1bad50c361.text: on the acquisition date, in accordance with IFRS3 revised:

740bca3a-2d5b-4444-9460-e07442375faa.text: the identiﬁable assets acquired and the liabilities and contingent

feaec447-4757-42ea-a682-e9d02b93b4c9.text: liabilities assumed are measured at fair value;

338829ba-7ca5-477f-93af-c0a10502695e.text: any minority interests in an acquiree are measured as the

def93327-418a-42ad-943e-996a86604e5d.text: minority interest’s proportionate share of the acquiree’s net

496cc095-a296-4ad5-b611-01b392cccbf6.text: identiﬁable assets or at fair value. This option is applied on

9a7445a9-fef4-4bc6-98d9-4ce01c3e0060.text: the consideration transferred and any contingent consideration

ecc1ab51-5e55-41c1-bd92-e8bf8c54837a.text: acquisition-related costs are recorded as expenses in the

dd46b9a5-699b-4bba-92ac-833cf97159d7.text: periods in which they are incurred.

57caee27-82bd-4ae9-a4c0-4be1167f60dd.text: For a business combination achieved in stages, any previously held

7b978dc3-532f-4b88-82e7-0e6bad62ba33.text: equity interests in the acquiree are measured at the acquisition-date

7da1d9cf-1006-4fa0-9fa6-a6558001f79f.text: fair value. Any resulting gains or losses are recognized in proﬁt or loss.

f12aea0a-c93c-4627-bcbd-45c75b502cc0.text: The measurement period of a business combination shall not

64f94e68-0d9d-44d8-bfd7-bb2f64ec071b.text: exceed 12  months as of the acquisition date. Any adjustments

cecfd72b-072a-45a2-b768-bd5fa8439a6e.text: to the consideration transferred after the measurement period are

29e1e1df-3bd4-4b58-83f5-e86a4d51b670.text: On the acquisition date, goodwill is recognized in the consolidated

9648a234-dd40-4790-bba0-10f0a8d925eb.text: balance sheet as the difference between:

9efc4b34-4bfd-4c66-aadd-d9db5f301d3e.text: the consideration transferred plus the amount of minority

fcf4c4d2-1946-4e06-86d2-a0c93a30aeec.text: interests in the acquiree and the fair value of the previously

7f953ea4-d46e-4622-833d-a6f2e188c142.text: the fair value of the identiﬁable assets acquired and the

e147b476-8cd2-4425-9043-cb87101ed62d.text: Negative goodwill is recognized immediately through proﬁt or loss.

5a4eceb8-364d-45ef-bdce-e83cdcde4b9e.text: Business combinations achieved prior to January 1, 2010 have been

186895f1-e4af-4bcd-ae8e-703b43236675.text: accounted for in accordance with the former versions of IFRS3 and

1e221529-fa01-4601-9c5b-f408bb101fdf.text: IAS27. These standards had already adopted the acquisition method

938ad39e-d23e-4fe1-a379-f46cc34c3d0a.text: in the version published by the IASB in March 2004. The main

f5baf0ee-b462-4bb9-9a6c-ec9b120b89c1.text: provisions which differ from the revised standards are as follows:

67fddc28-cf24-4541-8f85-ecc2d144dfa1.text: minority interests were measured based on their share of

08e76705-3050-437c-a037-17d47a50f5ca.text: the net identiﬁable assets of the acquiree and the fair value

66bd4a8e-30b1-4ad0-8c8d-75deaa6eb984.text: earn-outs were included in the acquisition cost, without time

330e4638-4e2a-462f-baa6-8ab6b7415f6e.text: limits, when the payment was deemed probable and the

77aa4163-f066-4c0f-be1d-a16ca38416e3.text: acquisition-related costs were recorded in the cost of the

712c82bc-52b7-4b92-a4e3-7d9f2f9426b7.text: For an acquisition achieved in stages, the fair value remeasurement

fbafb1c1-1888-4201-94d7-ccdd597633fd.text: of any previously held net asset was recognized in equity.

d5d1ba1b-368e-4c0c-8100-34f5da8acd40.text: For an acquisition of minority interests in a previously held

186cf8c6-d914-4d9e-9270-274597dcd660.text: company, the difference between the acquisition cost and the net

b03c1894-6986-4852-ab3c-a4043084c9e5.text: carrying amount of the minority interests was recorded in goodwill.

80bc2389-287c-48f2-b12e-1424804f5b84.text: At the time of the transition to IFRS and in accordance with the

1bd534eb-52af-4977-a0cd-71354f408994.text: exemption offered by IFRS1, the Group decided not to apply

1f5f6eab-3f89-4b2c-be78-707d1f94903e.text: that took place prior to January 1, 2004.

d524ca14-0cd6-4bf8-8e2b-cf5893ae70fa.text: Goodwill is allocated to cash-generating units (CGU) or groups

444ff4e8-115b-4d1c-99a6-4d9100077ca4.text: of cash-generating units. Subsequently, goodwill is not amortized

bc92c085-2b2d-4216-ac07-742380104b9a.text: but is tested for impairment annually or more frequently if there

a0dafa15-647c-4657-8a13-78e80d43cd0c.text: are any indications of impairment, in accordance with the method

e4941b27-1aba-48e2-bfd7-1b7e9257e531.text: Research and Development expenditures include all costs related

99b666b5-28d7-4bcb-9017-f4be0883dd14.text: to the scientiﬁc and technical activities, patent work, education

022ad672-c4d3-4ab9-8615-2ad1fb62b073.text: and training necessary to ensure the development, manufacturing,

542aa44d-c6f1-4a64-8c8b-429d286e1f2b.text: start-up, and commercialization of new or improved products or

00fdcb74-3067-4d7b-9a55-e484dc865bf4.text: According to IAS38, development costs shall be capitalized if,

4a93fb3a-9663-424e-9ddd-9045ef886913.text: and only if, the Group can meet all of the following criteria:

418e72eb-4301-4b1c-95c9-def89511b0b4.text: the intangible asset is clearly identiﬁed and the related costs

6b0a3747-c25d-424f-97e6-0305109be8de.text: the technical and industrial feasibility of completing the

6982b6cf-7152-4cbb-bacd-346f03061b75.text: there is a clear intention to complete the intangible asset and

5fc731ff-4bc5-43ff-befb-565f83e02f6e.text: the Group has the ability to use or sell the intangible asset

12b08075-7915-499c-867a-ac33288799ae.text: the Group can demonstrate how the intangible asset will

2209f90c-1e85-4e52-b7cf-dbd9854142d4.text: the Group has adequate technical, ﬁnancial and other

8196748f-3b0e-47df-adf6-89ec1dd3842b.text: resources to complete the development and to use or sell the

3a10a568-9604-48c6-9915-e2d21ee96afc.text: Research expenditure is recognized as an expense when incurred.

a63589b0-b83c-4d1c-a66f-6d5d88423c84.text: Internally generated intangible assets primarily include the

42f11e49-8e3d-435c-92ca-f214b900917b.text: development costs of information management systems. These

fad4d0cb-6ac7-4861-b3a2-e3e6487dd5c4.text: costs are capitalized only if they satisfy the criteria as deﬁned by

a3e4bdbb-9241-4e90-8d2a-2f637cb2a394.text: Internal and external development costs on management

e4459e5f-dc3b-495f-8ae8-8c2b38e435ac.text: information systems arising from the development phase are

8d1a9030-3d7f-4bed-8f07-2d6d7b62a60b.text: capitalized. Signiﬁcant maintenance and improvement costs are

b21f4952-13e3-4d9a-a6ca-6f5da061350c.text: added to the initial cost of assets if they speciﬁcally meet the

c847d090-7ceb-42f5-b7ad-361659da95ba.text: Internally generated intangible assets are amortized over their

42c1772c-12bd-4106-a820-07426e64c35b.text: Other intangible assets include separately acquired intangible

ca77030c-fbe0-4299-a028-a952ab602a04.text: assets such as software, licenses, and intellectual property rights.

5b4f28e2-4cbb-44b3-b35f-77b2eeeb48e4.text: They also include the technology, brands and customer contracts

969ee6b9-f039-4535-b0d3-fb9c23cd6ff3.text: valued upon the acquisition of companies in accordance with

417bcc36-d325-45a1-8e61-54af56b5acd9.text: With the exception of brands, intangible assets are amortized

ceb7e62a-20a5-4e1d-850d-566cfa45d72b.text: using the straight-line method over their useful lives. Information

9a88d93c-d403-4c4e-9585-1c9fab14ca5c.text: management systems are generally amortized over ﬁve and

a5cc2993-045e-44d8-a218-5532d912fa0d.text: seven years and customer contracts over a maximum period of

531915fa-876b-4ac1-8096-ca965bef4ab2.text: 25 years, considering the probabilities of renewal.

314e6c9f-7fad-4877-8cf3-d2b9ef523421.text: Land, buildings and equipment are carried at cost less any

0f6f0f69-3696-4abf-b3b9-03eb158dc97f.text: accumulated depreciation and any accumulated impairment losses.

8b8aca3a-29bb-456d-8696-9e44a9d49847.text: In the event of mandatory dismantling or asset removals, related

b067c111-cff2-4659-834c-4be192600633.text: costs are added to the initial cost of the relevant assets and

15870dc0-3f09-426a-87b6-c1dd21d4cfaa.text: provisions are recognized to cover these costs.

602a8ef2-d480-4b5a-8af7-ac415a67bea8.text: Interest costs on borrowings to ﬁnance the construction of

f0039714-b62d-4c3d-852e-831af6172a7b.text: property, plant, and equipment are capitalized during the period

cb9ea8b3-075a-4bdc-b366-5bab6d822145.text: of construction when they relate to the ﬁnancing of industrial

2eca9a2a-11c8-467b-96cc-a00f0464a22f.text: projects over a twelve-month construction period, or longer.

b34d5e8a-b5b6-46f7-b054-3a16f6786d2e.text: When parts of an item of property, plant and equipment have

f46a0d71-c380-42c6-9444-17033a905ec6.text: different useful lives, they are accounted for separately and

a17c94b9-7810-4f70-b91f-44d62da59af8.text: depreciated over their own useful lives.

cb31ed33-43f4-440f-8fc7-2ea8f4583d40.text: Repair and maintenance costs are recognized as expenses

0f52b1c5-e261-4308-ad8c-d2e32396e5c5.text: when incurred. The costs of major inspections and overhauls

cd5adbde-7aa0-4fef-a2b8-f90bec380204.text: are recognized as a separate component of the asset and are

0043cd76-4963-4c64-9c52-1a84ae297889.text: depreciated over the period between two major overhauls.

1df2aa0f-5d66-4586-841c-9936b0735f31.text: Depreciation is calculated according to the straight-line method

d1b4e8ec-efe5-4e7c-b431-cd59c8ebf5e4.text: over the estimated useful lives as follows:

b7cc9720-4275-4c5e-b9e0-2acfa32f7498.text: In accordance with IAS36, the Group regularly assesses whether

ee9f35ae-6f3a-47d0-a7a8-d5003419c786.text: there are any indications of asset impairment. If such indications

55efa0fc-6784-4a4a-9895-1fb91129d8e8.text: exist, an impairment test is performed to assess whether the

2e9169b4-80bc-4e1e-843b-d4608ce68f5d.text: carrying amount of the asset is greater than its recoverable

88a55a1a-3620-49d5-9af7-ad1ad340cd18.text: amount, deﬁned as the higher of the fair value less costs to sell

896b84d5-6483-49d9-9b91-af158b3f37ba.text: (net fair value) and the value in use.

cdd493fb-7518-4473-93e5-f132b1932b4e.text: Impairment tests are performed systematically once a year for

877f9785-9927-4f7f-b8a3-b318067ddaab.text: goodwill and intangible assets with indeﬁnite useful lives.

266af01d-3c28-447b-8833-2e23fb064fad.text: Assets that do not generate largely independent cash ﬂows are

e85acc29-078a-42b0-b31b-34b1331740b2.text: grouped according to the cash-generating units (CGU) to which

5faac430-34a9-45d5-9322-7126c279c39d.text: they belong. A cash-generating unit is an identiﬁable group of

e6321d80-e8db-4afb-a8e8-8f5461e0ff19.text: assets that generates cash inﬂows that are largely independent

cef764f4-6aa9-43cc-9bec-2696112adb38.text: of the cash inﬂows of other assets or groups of assets. They are

fab7441e-24e8-45c8-996b-d5bf4d71efd5.text: mainly determined on a geographical basis and by reference to

1d8182fd-a036-4036-941f-3424ad200d6d.text: the markets in which the Group operates.

b5bb94d7-89bd-403e-8180-dbe1706d5444.text: In practice, the Group performs impairment tests at various levels

73d632b8-bf07-48a4-a1d7-115e89c44f8c.text: pursuant to these principles and in accordance with IAS36:

94bafd34-e70c-44a6-9132-8d40bc36b212.text: dedicated and on-site plants are tested individually;

8dd6e3e6-a221-484b-90e3-aca25ca8c978.text: pipelines and plants that provide these pipelines are tested at

20530767-1add-4024-ba8a-6b52dbea3a18.text: liquid gas and hydrogen/CO plants are grouped together

3bf9687c-1276-45d9-a0cd-6e655a1a57c0.text: according to the plants’ customer market;

b8ee8bf1-0d83-48db-abd1-99e15e6ee219.text: other assets are allocated to cash-generating units or groups

9705f297-7458-4cb5-ab5a-58a91d551acb.text: The cash-generating units of the Gas and Services activity are

036d8997-fc07-4f84-8104-6ebaf26c90a0.text: determined on a geographical basis. The Other Activities are

d3b136e3-b995-45f8-b8e7-b5dfc8668284.text: managed at the European (Welding) or worldwide (Engineering
